title: The Project's Hamish Macdonald is left speechless after an X-rated joke
text:
The Project host Hamish Macdonald is known for his professionalism.

But on Tuesday, the 38-year-old was left momentarily speechless after comedian Tommy Little said an X-rated joke live.

Tommy first entered into a bit of banter about Today Show weatherman Steve Jacobs' live cross who from Fiji this week.

'If you do it the other way you'll get arrested' The Project's Hamish Macdonald was left speechless after an X-rated joke by co-host Tommy Little on Tuesday night's episode

During a segment Steve was wearing a Hawaiian shirt while sipping on a Piña colada cocktail on the idyllic island.

The weatherman said in the video that he found a place he could 'drop and flop' while sipping on his Piña colada.

Clearly not one to let a joke pass, Tommy immediately said: 'That move is the drop and flop, if you do that in the opposite order, you get arrested.'

The X-rated joke saw the panel burst into laughter, with Hamish appearing to struggle to compose himself for the next news item.

Awkward: Tommy told the co-host Hamish (pictured): 'Hamish, do you want to speak or are you just thinking about dropping and flopping?'

'Your turn there Hamish,' Carrie said, cajoling him into action.

'Hamish, do you want to speak or are you just thinking about dropping and flopping?' Tommy added cheekily.

As the awkwardness ticked by it appeared Hamish struggled to get a word out, as both Carrie and Tommy offered him a hand.

'If you're just walking in the door from work and there's not much left in the tank,' Carrie began, seemingly reading from the show's teleprompter.

Cheeky: Comedian Tommy (pictured) appeared to revel in the mischievous joke, which had the studio audience laughing too

'If you've just walked in from work then just tell yourself to drop and flop,' Tommy joked.

Ending the segment, Hamish started to look more lively: 'If you've just walked in the door and you haven't got much left in the tank, you're not alone. You're not alone.'

Getting over his fit of the giggles, Hamish went on to present the next news item on work/life balance.
